result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke

records.addlTxt:
2:49 PM Defendant Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Court questions the defendant if he has spoke with the State Public Defender's Office and was determined to not be eligible.
Defendant did not know that he could petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Court will be adjourning the Initial Appearance.
Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant is to apply today to petition the court for an attorney.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond is continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3

Follow all conditions of bond in all open cases.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.

1:24 PM Defendant Michael E Bahrke appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present in Court.
Court verifies if the defendant can hear and see via Zoom.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant  is not  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
